rev.desc.rev.desc: reference table line position is not changed while the Field Name is changed
. add reference table in list whin init
update panel process, unique.key in $L.file support primary key
Panel process
default the new Usage Type field to an empty array
Panel process
default the new globallist field to an empty array
Panel decide.init.datadict
Added a second decision exit to init to catch the case where an empty datadict record is passed in.
Dealing with globallist that don't exist when upgrading from old versions.
Catch bad initializations that can happen in the upgrade
Add call to make "pretty" captions if no manual caption is entered.
updated the set.captions panel so that the fields set in the datadict no longer contain the structure name.
On process and set.caption panels, removed references to SOAP fields.
Fixed array position for sysFieldType and globallist fields.
Modification made for DevTx ticket I2322.

Some datadict records have bad data in them in that the contents of the contents of the field name extattrname is a character string instead of an array. When this is the case, it is causing this application to issue the error message "Indexing into a STRING2 type datum which is not a compound data type error" when it is attempting to execute the statement $L.i in extattrname in $L.file=nullsub($L.x in $L.ext, NULL) in panel set.captions.
To remedy this problem, a line was added to panel named process that forces the value of the extrattrname to be a null array IF its contents are something other than an array.
System Fields array position will now be maintained the same as the other field arrays.
Fixed a bug with the sqlbasename generation.
Added processing to handle sqlbasename (always required + short-name convention using a counter).
Added functionality to process and set.captions panels to process the three new soafields: soacaption, soadatatype, and soaexclude.
Preset the engine.access flag to true on all new datadicts:
- on set.add, added expression engine.access in $L.file=true
Modification made for CenterPoint Task 22900 for Request 24287.
Fix made for application upgrade. This prevents the message "Indexing into STRING2 type datum which is not a compound data type" from appearing in the sc.log.
See the MSWord document named Tsk22900Rqs24287 for details of what was done.
Keep the extattrname array in line with the fields array.
In the get panel, changed the value being passed in the Fields of Type parameter from scalar to datadict
Removed last change. Was not the problem.
Defaulted new fields for upgrade.
Added information for the new encrypt field.

In panels process and set.captions, corrected typo for invisible (was visible before). Also, in panel process, reset both invisible and readonly arrays to be {} so that when viewing from Data Policy, these arrays will be sorted properly.
Modified panels process and set.captions to save the old LDAP mappings.
Changed to accept "name" as the only parameter

descript.descript: reference table line position is not changed while the Field Name is changed
. add reference table in list whin init
update panel process, unique.key in $L.file support primary key
Panel process
default the new Usage Type field to an empty array
Panel process
default the new globallist field to an empty array
Panel decide.init.datadict
Added a second decision exit to init to catch the case where an empty datadict record is passed in.
Dealing with globallist that don't exist when upgrading from old versions.
Catch bad initializations that can happen in the upgrade
Add call to make "pretty" captions if no manual caption is entered.
updated the set.captions panel so that the fields set in the datadict no longer contain the structure name.
On process and set.caption panels, removed references to SOAP fields.
Fixed array position for sysFieldType and globallist fields.
Modification made for DevTx ticket I2322.

Some datadict records have bad data in them in that the contents of the contents of the field name extattrname is a character string instead of an array. When this is the case, it is causing this application to issue the error message "Indexing into a STRING2 type datum which is not a compound data type error" when it is attempting to execute the statement $L.i in extattrname in $L.file=nullsub($L.x in $L.ext, NULL) in panel set.captions.
To remedy this problem, a line was added to panel named process that forces the value of the extrattrname to be a null array IF its contents are something other than an array.
System Fields array position will now be maintained the same as the other field arrays.
Fixed a bug with the sqlbasename generation.
Added processing to handle sqlbasename (always required + short-name convention using a counter).
Added functionality to process and set.captions panels to process the three new soafields: soacaption, soadatatype, and soaexclude.
Preset the engine.access flag to true on all new datadicts:
- on set.add, added expression engine.access in $L.file=true
Modification made for CenterPoint Task 22900 for Request 24287.
Fix made for application upgrade. This prevents the message "Indexing into STRING2 type datum which is not a compound data type" from appearing in the sc.log.
See the MSWord document named Tsk22900Rqs24287 for details of what was done.
Keep the extattrname array in line with the fields array.
In the get panel, changed the value being passed in the Fields of Type parameter from scalar to datadict
Removed last change. Was not the problem.
Defaulted new fields for upgrade.
Added information for the new encrypt field.

In panels process and set.captions, corrected typo for invisible (was visible before). Also, in panel process, reset both invisible and readonly arrays to be {} so that when viewing from Data Policy, these arrays will be sorted properly.
Modified panels process and set.captions to save the old LDAP mappings.
Populate the new irfields array from the IR key in the dbdict.
Changed to accept "name" as the only parameter
